compboost 0.1.0
  • Getting Started
  • Functionality
    • Base-Learner
    • Loss Functions
  • Reference

Wrapper to boost general additive models for each feature.

boostSplines.Rd

This wrapper function automatically initialize the model by adding all numerical features as spline base-learner. Categorical features are dummy encoded and inserted using another linear base-learners without intercept. The function boostSplines does also train the model.

boostSplines(data, target, optimizer = OptimizerCoordinateDescent$new(),
  loss, learning.rate = 0.05, iterations = 100, trace = -1,
  degree = 3, n.knots = 20, penalty = 2, differences = 2,
  data.source = InMemoryData, data.target = InMemoryData,
  oob.fraction = NULL)

Arguments

data

[data.frame]
A data frame containing the data.
target

[character(1)]
Character value containing the target variable. Note that the loss must match the data type of the target.
optimizer

[S4 Optimizer]
An initialized S4 Optimizer object exposed by Rcpp (e.g. OptimizerCoordinateDescent$new()) to select features at each iteration.
loss

[S4 Loss]
Initialized S4 Loss object exposed by Rcpp that is used to calculate the risk and pseudo residuals (e.g. LossQuadratic$new()).
learning.rate

[numeric(1)]
Learning rate to shrink the parameter in each step.
iterations

[integer(1)]
Number of iterations that are trained.
trace

[integer(1)]
Integer indicating how often a trace should be printed. Specifying trace = 10, then every 10th iteration is printed. If no trace should be printed set trace = 0. Default is -1 which means that in total 40 iterations are printed.
degree

[integer(1)]
Polynomial degree of the splines.
n.knots

[integer(1)]
Number of equidistant "inner knots". The actual number of used knots does also depend on the polynomial degree.
penalty

[numeric(1)]
Penalty term for p-splines. If the penalty equals 0, then ordinary b-splines are fitted. The higher the penalty, the higher the smoothness.
differences

[integer(1)]
Number of differences that are used for penalization. The higher the difference, the higher the smoothness.
data.source

[S4 Data]
Uninitialized S4 Data object which is used to store the data. At the moment just in memory training is supported.
data.target

[S4 Data]
Uninitialized S4 Data object which is used to store the data. At the moment just in memory training is supported.
oob.fraction

[numeric(1)]
Fraction of how much data we want to use to track the out of bag risk.

Value

A model of the Compboost class. This model is an R6 object which can be used for retraining, predicting, plotting, and anything described in ?Compboost.

Details

The returned object is an object of the Compboost class. This object can be used for further analyses (see ?Compboost for details).

Examples

mod = boostSplines(data = iris, target = "Sepal.Length", loss = LossQuadratic$new(),
  oob.fraction = 0.3)
